corpses.name: Hyper-V Server
corpses.description: a freeware edition of Windows Server with the hypervisor, virtualization capabilities, and other limited infrastructure functionality

corpses.name: HoloLens
corpses.description: a mixed reality headset that allowed users to interact with holograms in the real world

corpses.name: Publisher
corpses.description: a desktop publishing application that allowed users to create graphical layouts and documents for print and digital media

corpses.name: InfoPath
corpses.description: a digital forms and data-gathering application designed for business users and developers

corpses.name: Azure Blueprints
corpses.description: a declarative way to orchestrate the deployment of various resource templates, policies, role assignments, and other artifacts

corpses.name: Azure Data Studio
corpses.description: a lightweight, cross-platform data management and development tool for data professionals using the Microsoft family of on-premises and cloud data platforms

corpses.name: Visual Studio LightSwitch
corpses.description: a low-code development tool that enabled users to create business applications for the desktop, cloud, and mobile devices

corpses.name: Windows 10
corpses.description: a major release of the Windows NT operating system succeeding Windows 8.1

corpses.name: Dev Home
corpses.description: a Windows application that offered a centralized location for simplified machine configuration, system monitoring, and widget extensions for developers

corpses.name: Visual Studio App Center
corpses.description: a set of cloud services for managing the lifecycle of mobile and desktop applications, including automated builds, device testing, and distribution

corpses.name: Windows Subsystem for Android
corpses.description: a system that enables your Windows 11 device to run Android applications that are available in the Amazon Appstore

corpses.name: Xbox Avatars
corpses.description: a feature that allowed Xbox users to create and customize their own avatars for use in games and on their profiles

corpses.name: Windows Calendar
corpses.description: a simple calendar application that allowed users to manage events, appointments, and reminders

corpses.name: Windows People
corpses.description: a simple contact management application that allowed users to store and organize contact information

corpses.name: Delve
corpses.description: a search and discovery experience for Microsoft 365 users to find and organize content powered by the Microsoft Graph

corpses.name: Windows Mail
corpses.description: a simple mail client that allowed users to send, receive, and manage email messages

corpses.name: Paint 3D
corpses.description: a 3D modeling and computer graphics editor that allowed users to create and manipulate 3D objects

corpses.name: Flip
corpses.description: a video discussion platform for classrooms that allowed teachers to post topics and students to respond with short videos

corpses.name: Visual Studio for Mac
corpses.description: a Mac-specific integrated development environment for projects using Mono or the .NET cross-platform framework

corpses.name: Xbox 360 Store
corpses.description: a marketplace for digital games released on the Xbox 360 console

corpses.name: World of Warcraft Companion App
corpses.description: a mobile application that allowed WoW players to manage their characters, track missions, and chat with guild members

corpses.name: Alpha Dog Games
corpses.description: a game development studio that was acquired by Microsoft with the acquisition of ZeniMax Media and known for mobile games Mighty DOOM and Wraithborne

corpses.name: Xamarin
corpses.description: a cross-platform application development tool and framework for building native platform applications and extended the .NET ecosystem

corpses.name: Teams Wiki
corpses.description: an in-app feature of Teams that allowed users to create and edit wiki pages within a channel

corpses.name: Odyssey
corpses.description: an unreleased survival game that was in development by Blizzard and cancelled after the acquisition of Activision Blizzard by Microsoft

corpses.name: Dynamics 365 Human Resources
corpses.description: a stand-alone offering of the Dynamics 365 HR module that runs independently from Finance and Operations

corpses.name: Windows Mixed Reality
corpses.description: an augmented and virtual reality platform for compatible Windows headsets

corpses.name: LinkedIn Skill Assessments
corpses.description: a feature that allowed users to validate their skills via standardized quizzes and then showcase proficiency with a profile badge

corpses.name: Tips
corpses.description: an introductory system application that provided a welcome experience, feature updates, and general usage tips for Windows users

corpses.name: VBScript
corpses.description: an Active Scripting language modeled on Visual Basic

corpses.name: Xbox Live Gold
corpses.description: a gaming subscription service that enabled console multiplayer services

corpses.name: Surface Duo
corpses.description: a line of dual-screen Android devices that acted as Microsoft's re-entry into the mobile device market

corpses.name: WordPad
corpses.description: a basic word processor software with rich text editing

corpses.name: Kaizala
corpses.description: a secure messaging and workplace productivity application for collaboration

corpses.name: Cortana
corpses.description: a virtual assistant that used Bing search engine to perform tasks

corpses.name: Soundscape
corpses.description: an iOS app that used 3D audio technology to help users get around and explore their surroundings

corpses.name: Kinect
corpses.description: a motion sensing input device originally launched as a gaming peripheral and later acted as a development tool for machine learning, visual recognition, and robotics

corpses.name: Money in Excel
corpses.description: a personal finance management add-in for Excel that allowed users to connect their bank and credit card accounts

corpses.name: AltspaceVR
corpses.description: a social VR platform that allowed users to attend live events, play games, and watch videos with other users

corpses.name: Interix
corpses.description: an optional Unix subsystem for Windows NT-based operating systems

corpses.name: Windows 8.1
corpses.description: a release of the Windows NT operating system succeeding Windows 8 with an improved Start screen

corpses.name: Atom
corpses.description: a free, cross-platform, open-source text and source code editor developed by GitHub

corpses.name: SQL Server Data Mining
corpses.description: an integrated platform for predictive analytics and machine learning

corpses.name: Trident
corpses.description: a proprietary browser engine (aka MSHTML) for Internet Explorer and IE mode of Edge

corpses.name: JScript
corpses.description: a dialect of the ECMAScript standard used by Internet Explorer

corpses.name: Internet Explorer
corpses.description: a web browser that once attained a peak 95% usage share

corpses.name: Forza Street
corpses.description: a free-to-play racing game developed by Electric Square and initially released as Miami Street on Windows PCs before rebranding and launching on mobile devices

corpses.name: Azure Scheduler
corpses.description: a cloud-based job scheduling service that allowed administrators configure and automatically run scheduled logic

corpses.name: LinkedIn Salary
corpses.description: a feature that allowed individual users to discover earning potential and salary insights based on factors such as job title and location

corpses.name: Channel 9
corpses.description: a website for hosting videos and podcasts that Microsoft employees created and the company's first blob

corpses.name: Silverlight
corpses.description: an application framework for writing and running web applications

corpses.name: Azure Blockchain
corpses.description: a managed blockchain service that allowed users to build, govern, and expand consortium blockchain networks

corpses.name: Skype for Business
corpses.description: an enterprise software application for instant messaging and videotelephony

corpses.name: Xbox SmartGlass
corpses.description: a companion application to provide supplement content while playing games on Xbox devices

corpses.name: Minecraft Earth
corpses.description: an augmented reality and geo-location sandbox game that allowed players to build structures in the real world

corpses.name: Azure Dev Spaces
corpses.description: a development tool that allowed developers to work on Kubernetes applications without needing to replicate a production environment

corpses.name: Gears POP!
corpses.description: a mobile real-time strategy game in which two players battle using Funko POP! stylized characters

corpses.name: Flight Arcade
corpses.description: a free-to-play flight simulator and demonstration of how modern browsers handle high-end 3D graphics

corpses.name: EdgeHTML
corpses.description: a proprietary browser engine used in Edge before being replaced by the Chromium-based version of Edge

corpses.name: Visual Studio Codespaces
corpses.description: a service providing cloud-hosted development environments

corpses.name: Bleeding Edge
corpses.description: a multiplayer online battle arena game developed by Ninja Theory

corpses.name: Xbox One
corpses.description: the third gaming console from Microsoft and competed closely with the PlayStation 4

corpses.name: Xbox Upload Studio
corpses.description: a console-native video editing tool that allowed users to create and share game captures

corpses.name: Mixer
corpses.description: a gaming streaming platform that allowed viewers to interact with and watch streamers

corpses.name: Expression Studio
corpses.description: a suite of tools for professional designers and developers to create feature-rich websites

corpses.name: Wunderlist
corpses.description: a task management application that allowed users to creat lists of and manage tasks across devices

corpses.name: Windows Analytics
corpses.description: a cloud service to check Windows device upgrade readiness, update compliance, and device health

corpses.name: Windows 7
corpses.description: a major release of the Windows NT operating system succeeding and improving on Windows Vista

corpses.name: Windows Phone
corpses.description: a family of mobile operating systems that succeeded Windows Mobile and Zune before being discontinued

corpses.name: HealthVault
corpses.description: a web-based personal health record to store and maintain health and fitness information

corpses.name: HockeyApp
corpses.description: a platform for mobile app distribution, crash reporting, and gathering user feedback and metrics acquired by Microsoft

corpses.name: Zo
corpses.description: a chatbot that was a successor to Tay and was available on Kik, Facebook, GroupMe, and Twitter

corpses.name: Age of Empires: Castle Siege
corpses.description: an on-the-go version of the classic real-time strategy game that allowed players to build, maintain, and defend their castle

corpses.name: PowerPoint Viewer
corpses.description: a freeware program for Windows that can display and print Microsoft PowerPoint presentations

corpses.name: Excel Viewer
corpses.description: a freeware program for Windows that can display and print Microsoft Excel spreadsheets

corpses.name: Reader
corpses.description: a freeware program for reading documents in PDF, XPS, and TIFF formats

corpses.name: PerformancePoint Server
corpses.description: a business intelligence software that allowed users to monitor, analyze, and plan business activities, later integrated into SharePoint Server before discontinuation

corpses.name: Groove Music Pass
corpses.description: a music subscription service that allowed streaming of its music catalog to a device

corpses.name: CodePlex
corpses.description: an open-source developer platform for hosting software project source code, wiki pages, and issue tracking

corpses.name: Word Viewer
corpses.description: a freeware program for Windows that can display and print Microsoft Word documents

corpses.name: WebMatrix
corpses.description: a lightweight web development tool with full support for PHP and ASP.NET web pages that succeeded ASP.NET Web Matrix

corpses.name: Visual J#
corpses.description: an implementation of the J# programming language and transitional language for Java developers into the .NET ecosystem

corpses.name: Azure RemoteApp
corpses.description: a cloud-based service that allowed administrators to publish individual applications to end user virtual desktops for installation and use

corpses.name: Visual SourceSafe
corpses.description: a source control software, originally created by One Tree Software before being acquired by Microsoft

corpses.name: ProClarity
corpses.description: a business intelligence solution that allowed users to analyze data and create graphical visualizations, acquired by Microsoft in 2006

corpses.name: Xbox Fitness
corpses.description: a service providing fitness videos and used the Kinect sensor to track player heart rate and calorie burn

corpses.name: So.cl
corpses.description: a social networking service and social search engine allowing the posting of collages to be shared with friends or followers

corpses.name: Windows Vista
corpses.description: a major release of the Windows NT operating system, succeeding Windows XP

corpses.name: Windows Movie Maker
corpses.description: a video editing software that allowed users to create and edit videos as well as publish them on OneDrive, Facebook, Vimeo, YouTube, and Flickr

corpses.name: Windows Photo Gallery
corpses.description: a photo management software that allowed users to import photos from their cameras, organize them into albums, and edit them

corpses.name: Windows Live Writer
corpses.description: a desktop blog-publishing application that allowed users to compose blog posts offline and publish them to their website

corpses.name: Windows Live Mail
corpses.description: a desktop email client that allowed users to access multiple email accounts in one place

corpses.name: Scalebound
corpses.description: an unreleased action role-playing game in development by PlatinumGames and to be published by Microsoft before being cancelled

corpses.name: Lumia
corpses.description: a line of mobile devices running Windows Phone operating system originally created by Nokia before being acquired and later abandoned by Microsoft

corpses.name: Band
corpses.description: a smart band with smartwatch and fitness tracker features

corpses.name: Sunrise
corpses.description: a calendar application that provided a comprehensive view of daily events before later being acquired by Microsoft and merged into Outlook

corpses.name: Project Spark
corpses.description: a game creation video game that allowed users to create their own games, movies, and other experiences

corpses.name: Lionhead Studios
corpses.description: a British video game development studio best known for Black & White and Fable series

corpses.name: Xbox 360
corpses.description: the second gaming console from Microsoft and competed with the PlayStation 3 and Nintendo Wii in the seventh generation of console gaming hardware

corpses.name: Fable Legends
corpses.description: a cancelled 4v1 multiplayer entry in the Fable series before being cancelled and its active beta shutdown before release

corpses.name: Tay
corpses.description: an artificial intelligence chatbot released on Twitter that was shut down after only 16 hours due to inflammatory tweets

corpses.name: Press Play
corpses.description: a Danish video game development studio best known for Max & the Magic Marker, Max: The Curse of Brotherhood, and Kalimba

corpses.name: Windows 8
corpses.description: a major release of the Windows NT operating system with a touch-optimized experience and based on Metro design language

corpses.name: Forefront
corpses.description: a suite of security solutions including network gateways, email spam and virus protection, and identity management

corpses.name: Windows Media Center
corpses.description: a digital video recorder and media player that allowed users to watch and record live TV, as well as organize and play music and videos

corpses.name: FoxPro
corpses.description: a data-centric procedural programming language and database management system originally developed by Fox Software before being acquired by Microsoft

corpses.name: Midori
corpses.description: a managed code operating system that was in research and development but never released

corpses.name: Windows Live Messenger
corpses.description: a cross-platform instant-messaging client

corpses.name: Xbox Entertainment Studios
corpses.description: a television and movie studio that produced original content for Xbox Live

corpses.name: Windows XP
corpses.description: a major release of the Windows operating system built on Windows NT kernel explicitly for consumer use

corpses.name: FrontPage
corpses.description: a WYSIWYG HTML editor and website administration tool that allowed users to create and manage web pages

corpses.name: XNA
corpses.description: a framework and tool set for developing video games for Windows, Xbox 360, and Windows Phone devices

corpses.name: PixelSense
corpses.description: a multi-touch digital table for public places that allowed multiple users to interact with the device simultaneously

corpses.name: Works
corpses.description: a lightweight, low-cost productivity software suite that included a word processor, spreadsheet, and a database management system

corpses.name: SQL Server English Query
corpses.description: a natural language processing tool that allowed users to query databases using English

corpses.name: Reader
corpses.description: an application for reading e-books and used its own .LIT format

corpses.name: Zune
corpses.description: a portable media player turned music software brand

corpses.name: Money
corpses.description: a personal finance management software that allowed users to track bank accounts, investments, and bills

corpses.name: Kin
corpses.description: a short-lived family of mobile devices that heavily integrated social networking services

corpses.name: Response Point
corpses.description: a software-based telephone private-branch-exchange system targeted towards small businesses

corpses.name: Encarta
corpses.description: a digital multimedia encyclopedia published initially available on CD-ROM or DVD before later being available online

corpses.name: Office Accounting
corpses.description: an accounting software application targeted towards small businesses

corpses.name: Agent
corpses.description: a software technology that utilized animated characters, text-to-speech engines, and speech recognition to interact with users

corpses.name: TrueSpace
corpses.description: a freeware 3D modeling and animation software that created by Caligari Corporation and later acquired by Microsoft in 2008

corpses.name: Ensemble Studios
corpses.description: a video game development studio best known for the Age of Empires series and launch of Halo Wars

corpses.name: Aces Game Studio
corpses.description: a video game development studio best known for the Microsoft Flight Simulator series

corpses.name: Tafiti
corpses.description: an animated search engine that used Silverlight to display search results

corpses.name: Windows 3.1
corpses.description: a major release of the Windows operating system and successor to Windows 3.0

corpses.name: MSJVM
corpses.description: a proprietary Java virtual machine from Microsoft

corpses.name: Clippit
corpses.description: the default Office Assistant and currently lives on in spirit as the Windows paperclip emoji

corpses.name: Office Assistant
corpses.description: an intelligent user interface for Microsoft Office products

corpses.name: Xbox
corpses.description: the first entry into the gaming console market by Microsoft and origin of the Xbox brand

corpses.name: MSN Music
corpses.description: a music download store made to compete with Apple's iTunes Music Store

corpses.name: Windows 98
corpses.description: a major release of the Windows operating system in 1998, succeeding Windows 95

corpses.name: Windows Millennium Edition
corpses.description: a major release of the Windows operating system in 2000, succeeding Windows 98

corpses.name: MS-DOS
corpses.description: an operating system for x86-based personal computers that was the dominant operating system in the 1980s

corpses.name: ASP.NET Web Matrix
corpses.description: a development tool that was a lightweight alternative to Visual Studio and ideal for web application workloads

corpses.name: Windows 95
corpses.description: a major release of the Windows operating system in 1995 and the first of the Windows 9x family

corpses.name: Windows 3.0
corpses.description: the third major release of the Windows operating system and successor to Windows 2.1

corpses.name: Windows 2.1
corpses.description: a major release of the Windows operating system and successor to Windows 2.0

corpses.name: Windows 2.0
corpses.description: the second major release of the Windows operating system and successor to Windows 1.0

corpses.name: Windows 1.0
corpses.description: the first major release of the Windows operating system

corpses.name: Fahrenheit
corpses.description: a suite of high-level 3D computer graphic APIs in development by Microsoft and SGI but abandoned before release

corpses.name: Bob
corpses.description: a Microsoft project intended to provide a personalized alternative interface for the Windows operating system
